node.title: This remote community experienced the NT's hardest lockdown. Here's what life was like
node.alt: an aboriginal man with a beard using a hose
node.description: For months, Billy Maroney had heard warnings of COVID-19 one day reaching a remote Indigenous community in the Northern Territory.
node.content:
["For months, Billy Maroney had heard warnings of\u00a0COVID-19 one day reaching\u00a0a remote Indigenous community in the Northern Territory.", "But when it\u00a0happened to his home of\u00a0Binjari near Katherine, he was in shock.\u00a0", "\u201cIt's one of the worst things I've ever actually been through,\" said Mr Maroney, one of about 300 residents.\u00a0", "On November 20, NT health authorities and police descended on Binjari and the nearby community of Rockhole to enforce rules that would ban residents from leaving home except for legal requirements and medical emergencies.", "The measures were unprecedented in the Northern Territory and have never been used since.", "", "
The pace of life in Binjari was relaxed before COVID hit.(ABC News: Hamish Harty)
", "Although\u00a0Rockhole was granted eased restrictions\u00a0by November 25, Binjari endured some form of\u00a0lockdown or lockout rules until Wednesday this week.", "For two and a half weeks, Mr Maroney was\u00a0confined to his home and yard with his two sons.", "One thing that is immediately apparent in Binjari at this time of year is the heat.", "While supplies were provided by police, the Australian Defence Force, health authorities and non-government organisations,\u00a0the searing temperatures were near inescapable.", "Mr Maroney and his sons were in a community they had called home for some time.\u00a0", "But during the lockdown period,\u00a0it wasn\u2019t the same.", "\u201cIt's a great place, we\u2019ve got everything we want here,\" he said.", "\"You\u2019re hunting and fishing, it\u2019s all good.\"", "Although he could tend his garden with his hose, hunting and fishing wasn\u2019t possible and life had never been stranger for Mr Maroney and his community.", "Not only were his freedoms missing, but so were almost 200 people, according to health authorities, who were transported to Howard Springs when they couldn't quarantine at home in Binjari.", "Among them was Mr Maroney's\u00a0partner Peggy, who travelled to the quarantine facility with two of the couple\u2019s grandsons.", "", "
NT health authorities transported Binjari COVID-19 cases and their close contacts to Howard Springs quarantine facility.(ABC News: Hamish Harty)
", "
Nightmares became reality
", "As the\u00a0Northern Territory\u2019s largest\u00a0outbreak was wrapping its claws around Binjari, fears of someone dying from the virus were front of mind.", "Evonne Booth, who works as an administrator with the Binjari Community Aboriginal Corporation,\u00a0knew immediately how serious the situation was.", "\u201cIt was a bit devastating,\" she said.\u00a0", "A day after Binjari moved from its hard lockdown to a normal lockdown, Ms Booth's worst fears came true.", "A 78-year-old Aboriginal Elder became the first person to die of COVID-19 in the NT.", "", "
Ms Booth said the woman who died was much-loved in Binjari.(ABC News: Hamish Harty)
", "Instead of\u00a0being by her bedside in hospital, the woman's family was\u00a0isolating at Howard Springs quarantine facility.\u00a0", "Ms Booth said the whole community was grieving her loss.", "\u201cStill mourning, still grieving \u2026 We're all families in the community,\u201d she said.", "Billy Maroney said her death will be felt for some time.", "\u201cThere\u2019s still a lot of sadness,\u201d he said.", "\"Me, personally, I can\u2019t talk about it.\"", "
The Territory is reopening, but it will come at a cost
", "Ms Booth is worried about the NT government's\u00a0re-opening plan that health authorities say will almost certainly result in more COVID\u00a0cases across the Territory.", "\u201cCOVID is still in town,\" she said.", "\"That\u2019s what we\u2019re worried about. You wouldn\u2019t even know if you got the virus, come back to community, it'll spread again.\u201d", "Mr Maroney supported the moves on police and health authorities, but thinks re-opening is unavoidable.", "\u201cFor that two weeks there was no choice but to be cooped up,\u201d he said.", "\u201cIt's a Territory thing. All we want to do is get on with our lives again.\"", "", "
